Name: Snakes and Ladders + Ludo With A Twist
Description:
Two games using the same custom six-sided dice, and different sides of the same board.

The 1 on the die becomes "M", allowing a single move in any direction (including diagonally in Snakes and Ladders), and the 2 becomes "S" allowing any two pawns to be swapped. The Snakes and Ladders game is played with four pawns, Ludo-style, and players must get all of their pawns to the 100 square to win.

Name: 2GM Campaign Book
Description:
Este libro contiene un total de 7 Campañas completas, y 74 escenarios, así como reglas opcionales. 108 paginas.

2GM Tactics Game Campaign Book, 108 pages with 7 complete campaigns and 74 scenarios, plus optional rules

Name: Kwis 't!
Description:
Kwis ‘t! is a quizgame with a twist. You are able to win without answering most questions correct. You win Kwis ‘t! by psychology, knowing your facts and a little luck. Every player answers the same five questions per round. After the correct answers have been given to you, you put your marker on how many questions you’ve answered correct. However, you can bluff! You can earn bonus by fooling your opponents and by calling a bluff of an opponent. Use your reputation as a walking encyclopaedia or a notorious braggart. If you outsmart your opponents, you win Kwis ‘t!

Kwis ‘t! is Dutch for Quiz it. If you pronounce it fast, it sounds like ‘I knew it’ (In Dutch). The game has easy game rules and contains lots of verbal and non-verbal interaction.

Kwis ‘t! has more than 1.150 original questions in all different kinds of categories. Every set of five questions consists of two open questions, two multiple choice questions (with A, B and C) and one 50/50 question. If you don’t know the answer, you can still make an educated guess. You guessed wrong? You can still bluff that you gave the correct answer.

Name: Krosmaster: Wild Realms
Description:
Krosmaster: Wild Realms is an expansion of 16 new figures for Krosmaster: Arena and other Krosmaster titles released exclusively in the form of blind boxes. Each Display case of 12 figurines comes with 4 random rares and one each of the 8 commons.

The list of figures in the set is as follows:
-Bwork Archer
-Bwork Warrior
-Bworker
-Snoowolf
-Boowolf
-Moowolf
-Ko-Fang The White
-Groarg Gamel
-Medor Thraki
-Raspberry King
-Lemon King
-Mint King
-Strawberry King
-Missiz Freezz
-Grougalorasalar
-Dragon Pig

Each of the jelly king comes with a figure of jelly it can summon.

Name: Monster Facial Expressions
Description:
Who thinks they can reach their nose with their tongue? And who can puff out their cheeks the most? The monster-sized funny faces provide guaranteed fun. Here we go! Throw dice, find a monster, make a monster face. A silly game for 2-4 players ages 5-99 that playfully helps to encourage verbal and motor skills.

—description from the publisher

Name: Virusbomb
Description:
An entry in the 2015 18 Card PNP design contest by J. Ramón Palacios.

Setup

     Shuffle and deal 8 cards to each player. Place the remaining card face up in the center of the table.
     The play area will be a 3x3 card grid, with that card at the center.
     The player who has been most recently sick chooses virus or leukocytes. The other player starts playing. The one with virus keeps the rules card as a reminder.


Gameplay

     In turns, each player play 1 card face up on the play area, on a free space or completely overlapping another card. To overlap a card, the new card number must be higher than the overlapped card.
     At the end of the game 9 cards must be exposed. None of the 9 spaces must be left uncovered. So, for instance, if there are 3 free spaces in the play area and players have 3 cards in their hands (one player with 2 cards; the other, 1 card), no more cards can


be overlapped.

     If there are no free spaces and you have a card whose number is lower than the numbers of the cards in the play area, that card is out of the game.
     The game ends when all the cards are played and the winner is the one with most virus or leukocytes on the board. In case of a tie, play again.

Name: Chibi Commander
Description:
Chibi Commander is a strategy game for 1 to 4 players. You command a squad of specialists. Try to fight against the Aliens or take over the command of this dark minded Enemies yourself. Play together with your friends in coop or against them. Or even play it alone against the game itself.

Play missions in many different locations, single or in campaign mode. Rescue civilians, try to steal technology, defend or attack targets, kidnap enemies and much more. Place trees, covers, craters, streets, giant mosters and hole UFOs which landed on the map.

Control 4 totally different races with a total of 80 units including civilians and animals. After each mission you will gain victory points which will allow you to upgrade your soldiers in secret.

The rules are very optimized and allows playing whole campaigns during one evening.

—description from the publisher

Name: Manhattan: Promo Cards Mini-Expansion
Description:
This small expansion consists of 10 cards as is for the game Manhattan (1994).  An 11th card contains the rules of the game.

These cards are shuffled, placed face down, and the top card is drawn at the start of each round.  They result in an additional fourth step in the scoring at the end of each round.  Points will be awarded based on the conditions listed for each card.

Here are some sample cards:
FOUNDER - each player scores one point for each building he started, but doesn't own any more.

VILLA - each 1 story building with at least one empty adjacent space scores one point

FAKE NEWS - There is no extra scoring for this card.  However, when scoring is about to begin, the next scoring card is revealed and that new card will be the scoring card for that round.

These cards are standard Euro mini-size.

Name: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon – The Tiger and the Phoenix
Description:
Tao Long: The Tiger and the Phoenix expansion replaces the earth dragon with a 3-tile tiger and a 1-tile phoenix. The phoenix starts off the board, so the earth / tiger-and-phoenix player starts with ¾ the length of the heaven dragon. The tiger is otherwise the same as the earth dragon, except that it can only expel water.

The phoenix functions like a single-tile dragon that can only repel fire, and whose damage removes fire stones.

The phoenix comes into play once the player's fire meter has at least 1 stone, by appearing adjacent to the tiger. If the player's fire meter becomes empty, the phoenix leaves the board again. As one might expect, each time the fire meter starts to fill, the phoenix rises again.

While the phoenix is on the board, the tiger-and-pheonix player gets to move both creatures, in any order.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon – The Pink Fluffy Bunny
Description:
Tao Long: The Pink Fluffy Bunny replaces one of the dragons, and functions like a single-tile dragon. Its turns are essentially double turns: spirit, matter, spirit, matter.

If its water meter is depleted, the bunny flips to its rabid-looking Fluffy's Last Stand side, and plays 1 additional [double] turn for each damage of overkill it had taken. If it does not win in this last-ditch rage, it loses.

Name: Zoid Battle
Description: Zoid Battle (actually, Zoid Battle 2) is a set of rules I wrote when the Zoids anime became popular in the US. I wrote them mainly to play Zoid-themed games at local game conventions. The rules are written for hex-based combat (approx. 50m per hex), and not actually intended for use with your full-sized Zoids toys or models - but you can certailny have them with you at the table to act as your mascots!

Name: Som i Serem Joc
Description:
Board game for the whole family.

Do you have what it takes to build a new state and culminate the history of Catalonia?

Rate and win your freedom!

Goal of the game:
The objective of the game is to collect the six cards"Som i Serem"and deposit them in the ballot box.

Game preparation:
Each player chooses a donkey and puts it in the starting box. The cards "Som i Serem" are mixed well, the cards ask and the letters of Saint George and the Dragon, and they are placed face down in their respective spaces on the board. Each player prepares an urn and puts it in front of him. Before beginning, each player takes 3 cards We and We will be from the stack. The game starts with the youngest player.

The boxes:
Each time we go through the start box we collect a "Som i Serem" card.
Make holidays in the Pyrenees, the Costa Brava and the Ebro Delta.
Go back to the Festa Major and the Sant Jordi Day.
Dialogue to Parliament.
Take unilateral action for the Good Sickle.
And if you put an urn in front of you, you know ... vote!

How to win:
Win the first person who introduces the six cards "Som i Serem" in the ballot box and reach the nearest Parliament box.
Once in the Parliament box, a parliamentary majority must be obtained by throwing the dice and removing 4 or more.
Once achieved, the game is won.
Live in Catalonia!

—description from the designer (translated)

Joc de taula per a tota la família.

Tens el que cal per construir un nou estat i culminar la història de Catalunya?

Vota i guanya la teva llibertat!

Contingut: 
4 rucs 
1 dau 
1 tauler de joc (40x40) 
60 cartes Som i Serem 
60 cartes de preguntes 
30 cartes de Sant Jordi i el Drac

Objectiu del joc:
L’objectiu del joc és recollir les sis cartes Som i Serem i dipositar-les a l’urna.

Preparació del joc:
Cada jugador tria un ruc i el posa a la casella d’inici. Es barregen bé les cartes Som i Serem, les cartes pregunta i les cartes de Sant Jordi i el Drac, i es col·loquen cap per avall en els seus respectius espais al tauler. Cada jugador es prepara una urna i la posa davant seu. Abans de començar, cada jugador agafa 3 cartes Som i Serem de la pila. La partida comença amb el jugador més jove.

Les caselles:
Cada cop que es passi per la casella d’inici es recull una carta Som i Serem.
Fes vacances als Pirineus, la Costa Brava i el Delta del Ebre.
Torna a tirar a la Festa Major i a la Diada de Sant Jordi.
Dialoga al Parlament.
Pren acció unilateral al Bon Cop de Falç.
I si et posen una urna davant, ja saps … vota!

Com es guanya:
Guanya la primera persona que introdueix les sis cartes Som i Serem dins l’urna i arriba a la casella de Parlament més propera.
Un cop a la casella de Parlament, s’ha d’assolir majoria parlamentària tirant el dau i treient un 4 o més.
Un cop aconseguit, es guanya el joc.
Visca Catalunya!
—description from the designer

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Köln
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: 100 Swords: Season 2 Promo Pack
Description:
Promotional cards given with the Season 2 Kickstarter.

Fluffy Doppelganger: Until end of turn, ignore the effect of a monster in the dungeon. You may pass that monster.

Inconceivable Singularity: When revealed, find and roll a die. This monster's defear cost and gold values equal the die's value.

Dungeon Press: When encountered, draw a card.

Warrior's Sword: "She let nothing hinder her pursuit of The Great Swords." Book of Forgeborn.
(Warrior's Sword is also used for the solo Weary Warrior variant)

Name: フタリシロ (Futarishiro)
Description:
ãƒ•ã‚¿ãƒªã‚·ãƒ­ (Futarishiro) is a castle-building game set in the age of warring states. To win, you must build a castle that's harder to overcome that the opponent's. Perhaps you can build a moat, arrange a tower, store weapons, train soldiers, and prepare for battle.

It's difficult to build a castle exactly as desired, though, as you have to read the psychology of your opponent to get the castle tiles that you want and design your territory in the best way.

Name: Seikoro Extension (星コロ　ミニ拡張)
Description: Seikoro Extension, a.k.a. æ˜Ÿã‚³ãƒ­ã€€ãƒŸãƒ‹æ‹¡å¼µ, adds star chips to the Seikoro base game. A star chip is placed at random above each constellation card in play, and whoever places the fifth cube on a card to finish it receives the chip as a bonus in addition to the points scored for their places occupied on the card.

Name: Dixit: Memories – Promo card
Description:
A promo card that expands Dixit: Memories by being added to the deck of cards.

The card looks like the cover of the Dixit: Memories expansion.

Shuffle the card in with the rest of the deck and proceed as normal.

Name: Gangs of Rome
Description:
Step into the streets and alleyways of the ancient Roman Empire. Those streets have become rife with carnage and unrest in these uncertain times. Gangs of brutal Fighters are used as weapons to exert the will of their paymasters. These paymasters, known as Domini, are ambitious heads of Roman households; as such a Dominus you begin your story in troubled times...

Gangs of Rome is a new skirmish game from War Banner in which you will use unique fighters, pitting them against the gangs of rival Domini in both campaign and scenario play to earn influence enough to manipulate your way into the Senate. Then, as a Senator of Rome, you will be granted the power destroy your enemies with methods far greater than the sword.

So hold on to your sandals and watch your back, Dominus!

Things are about to get bloody…

—description from the designer

Name: Operation Olympic/Ketsu-Go
Description:
OPERATION DOWNFALL: the planned but never executed Allied invasion of Japan was abandoned following the US atomic strikes on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Operation Olympic was to launch on November 1, 1945 with the objective to capture the southern third of the Japanese home island of Kyushu. After a rapid establishment of airbases and logistical hubs, this would then support the follow-up Operation Coronet that would strike near Tokyo planned for March 1946. The Japanese had long established their desire for a decisive battle to inflict an unacceptable level of casualties on the invading US troops, fueled by a fanatic devotion to their Emperor and country. The US invasion would provide that opportunity in a battle that promised ferocity to match or even exceed the epic and bloody German/Soviet struggle for Berlin. Operation Olympic/Ketsu-Go seeks to portray this situation in a playable simulation of the event. General Douglas MacArthur’s X-Day is about to start: it’s November 1, 1945…

Unit size: battalion/regiment.
Hexes are 3 km across.
Game Scale: 3 days/turn. 
Length: 20 turns (1 NOV 45-30 DEC 45).

Game system is a derivative of The Gamers’ Standard Combat Series. Unit symbols derived from Avalon Hill's The Longest Day are used on the half-inch, plastic counters.

There are three scenarios. The “historical” plan has “historical” forces for both US invaders and Japanese defenders. “An Olympic Miscalculation” adds the Japanese 36th Area Army to present a real challenge to the US plan. “Free for All” gives players wide latitude to try their own plans.

Rules cover weather, random events, artillery barrages, overruns, invasions, engineers, military police, assault guns, amtracs, evacuations, US replacement costs, air units, base capture and use, beachheads and ports, Rangers, US combined arms, chemical weapons, Japanese civil resistance, fortifications, banzai combat, infiltration tactics, infiltration teams, coastal fortifications, Special Attack Forces (“kamikazes”), US Little David mortar, and special terrain such as tunnels.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Fake News / Real News: Washington Edition
Description: Fake News / Real News is the fast-paced card game where players have to decide what's Fake News and what's Real News. Whether you politically lean left, lean right, or drive right down the middle, everyone can join in the fun. If you can decipher the real statements from the fake ones and determine which member of the administration said it then you will be the winner of Fake news / Real News, and have bragging rights through the next media cycle!

Name: Get The Picture
Description:
Got it! Spot it! Grab it!

Unleash your creativity... In under a minute you must describe the picture card in your hand for everybody to guess. Mime, Pose or use 3 Words to get them all thinking. Comparing your description to a host of possible cards on the table, it's a frantic race to first spot and then to grab the right picture.

Name: Noboribetsu (のぼりべつ)
Description:
In Noboribetsu, a.k.a. ã®ã¼ã‚Šã¹ã¤, each player wants to build a fine city, but you never know what you're going to get — and in the end your plans might just get shot to hell anyway.

Each player starts with an onsen (hot springs) card, and a deck of twelve locations, twelve characters, and four Hell cards is shuffled. On a turn, the active player rolls the die. On a roll of 2-5, they take the top card of the deck and add it to their city. If it's a location, they place it on the road from their hot springs; if it's a character they place it in a location or hot springs; if it's Hell, hey, it's also a location, so it gets connected to the road.

On a roll of 1 or 6, the first player to call "Noboribetsu!" gets to take the taxi (which allows them to draw two cards on a roll of 2-5) and move one top card in a city. They can steal an opponent's location or character; they can move a character to a matching location; or they can place a lone Hell card on an opponent's location.

When the deck runs out, players score nothing for Hell-inflicted locations, 2 points for each location and matching character card on it, and 1 point for all other cards. Whoever scores the most points earns 1 victory point, and after multiple games whoever earns 3 victory points first wins.

Name: Sensation!: Crazy Athlete
Description:
One player takes on the role of an athlete giving a tricky interview to three journalists. However, the athlete is exhausted after a hard training session and is fed up with all the interviews. Wanting to get rid of the journalists as soon as possible, the other two players are coaches who stand behind the Journalists and make motions helping the athlete decide what to say. The Journalists have to guess what topics the athlete is talking about.

Over the course of 6 rounds, each player scores points based on how well he does in his current role. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Crazy Celebrity
Description:
A wildly uproarious storytelling game that’s sure to be
a hit at any party. You and your friends will spin tales that
take such bizarre and unexpected turns that you’ll be
rolling on the floor with laughter!

Name: Crazy Professor
Description:
A wildly uproarious storytelling game that’s sure to be
a hit at any party. You and your friends will spin tales that
take such bizarre and unexpected turns that you’ll be
rolling on the floor with laughter!

Name: One Direction The Game
Description:
Will you be the first to complete your game card and make it backstage?  One Direction: The Game is a themed game for 2-4 players in which you answer questions, take challenges or complete actions in order to collect tokens.  Each token represents an item of One Direction memorabilia.  The object of the game is to be the first player to fill your game card with autographs, collectables and concert items.  Only the winner receives the backstage VIP pass necessary to complete their game card.

Players take it in turns to pick up cards that bring them closer to collecting tokens.  Do You Know? cards require the player to answer a question about One Direction to receive a token.  Action Cards for example may cause the player to miss a turn or trade tokens with another player.  Will You Dare? cards are family-friendly challenges such as "Do the chicken dance for 20 seconds" or "Sing happy birthday in a way that would get Harry's attention".

Name: Räuber Hotzenplotz: Hinterhalt im Räuberwald
Description:
Famous Räuber Hotzenplotz has esacped. Grandmother, Kaspar, Sepperl und Wachtmeister Dimpfelmoser are getting on his track to catch him. They want to be fast but have to avoid to stumble. Otherwise Räuber Hotzenplotz will be alarmed and move on.
By secretly picking up movement card players try to be the playing moving the fastet. But they have to avoid to get more than 6 movement points. If so the stumble and have to go back one space on the track while Hotzenplotz moves on.
The fastes player moves forward 2 spaces. When hitting exactly 6 movement points he even moves 3 spaces. When Hotzenplotz arrives at his hideout, he wins. When one of the players passes or reaches Hotzenplotz on the, the players win.

Name: Magic Maze: Maximum Security Bonus Tiles
Description: 2 new tiles for Magic Maze: Maximum Security from Plato magazine issue #102. They replace the tile 29 from module 13.

Name: This That & Everything: Places
Description:
In this rapid-fire game, players race to describe a wide variety of Places for their teammates to guess.

—descripton from the publisher

Name: Kort sagt sykt
Description:
Kort sagt sykt ("Basically sick") is a shameless party game in norwegian, where the purpose is to make funny, absurd and unfitting combinations of words, phrases, persons and situations.
To generalize, it's the norwegian version of Cards against humanity, with some new rules.

Published by the gaming store Outland, it’s one of their first games.

The rules vary from cards against the humanity. But are mostly the same.

Name: Pytagora
Description: The idea behind Pytagora is to have, instead of puzzle pieces with words, "arithmetic pieces": the ten digits from 0 to 9 and the four signs of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division, in addition to the sign of equality. The pieces are used to compose equalities and the game rewards you with more points for better combinations (numbers with more digits, using division or multiplication, using a piece already on the table).

Name: Crocodile Rock
Description:
The game is a race between different animals (interesting selection of "runners": frog, snake, turtle and snail). The winner is the first to reach the end of the track: the Crocodile Rock!
The peculiarity of the game is that each player on her turn throw three six-sided dice: two are regular ones numbered from 1 to 6 but the third one displays only "+" or "-" as a result.
The players need to accordingly add or subtract the two numbers to  determine how far they advance. A very good exercise for kids to learn basic math operations!
Some spaces on the board features a fixed number: in this case you only roll the +/- die and move forward or backward of that number of spaces. Other ones show only odd or even number: roll 1 die and advance only if you obtain an odd or even result, respectively.
The track also features a closed loop with a single specific space allowing access to the final section. There's also a few shortcuts, nicely depicted as jumping on a crocodile back or on logs.

Name: Rocket Darts
Description:
A space skill game from the American Toy Works, Brooklyn. The game requires players to use suction cup darts to knock down two rockets that are balanced on a vertical stand that is decorated with a Bulls eye and space scenes.

Each player has two shots to score points either by hitting the Bulls eye target or knocking the rockets off the stand. Highest score wins.
A variation of the game requires players to knock down the left rocket first and hit specific space scenes on the stand before finally knocking the right rocket down to win. Players load the suction cup dart into a shooter that resembles a small wooden bat with a central hole. The shooter has a rubber band stretched over the dart end to fire the dart at the targets.

American Games (A. Malloy) lists the game as being published in 1939.

Name: Railway Rivals Map LD: Lake District
Description: Railway Rivals Map LD Lake District: a map that can be used with both Railway Rivals and Dampfross. This map covers the English Lake District on a scale of 1 hex = 3.3km

Name: Play That Tune
Description:
Play that tune is a trivia/party game where players have to guess songs in team.

One player draws a card where 3 songs are noted with increasing difficulty. That player should pick one song and play it with a kazoo. The other team members have to guess the song. The harder the song the more points the team scores for discovering.

The game material consists of cards with songs written on them and 4 kazoos, each of a different color.

Name: Pie Town: Special Order Micro Expansion
Description:
The Special Order Card is a micro expansion for Pie Town.

Card Text:

When playing with this card, draw randomly from the ingredients bag 1 Common and 2 Rare Ingredients to place on the card. 
During play, players may bake a pie using these Ingredients to immediately score 4 Victory Points and guess one Ingredient of an opponent’s Secret Recipe. 
Refresh these ingredients after an order is filled.

Came with Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter.

Name: Treecolo
Description:
Memorise and find the hidden fruits and vegetables corresponding to spring, summer, autumn and winter. Be the smartest to complete your season first, but watch out for the wind and the lumberjack !

A game which allows children to practice their memory and observation skills.

Name: St. Crispin's Day
Description:
St. Crispin's Day is a simple print-and play hex and counter wargame meant to simulate the famous Battle of Agincourt. Victory will either be won or lost thanks to strategic movement and attacks of your units on the field of battle. While the French attack takes place in waves, the English player must survive the onslaught.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Šeimas
Description:
A game of political satire. A parody of 2016 Lithuanian Parliament election.

You are the leader of a political party which has 10 members. There are only two months left until the elections and events occur every day leaving no time for rest. On your road to success you will deal with social, economic and internal events and of course you will be part of scandals. By successfully resolving an event you will obtain rating points however by being part of a scandal you will lose them. You will be able to exchange rating points to the control of ministries and that will determine who will rule Šeimas.

In Šeimas as well as in Seimas (Lithuanian Parlament) the elections is the time for challenges.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Each player has 10 party member cards. Each party member has positive or negative competence points in each of the four fields (economic, internal affairs, social and scandals). The five event cards are picked, which represent an event happening each day of the working week. Events might be positive (economic, internal affairs or social) or negative (scandal). One event is opened and players bid party member to win (resolve) the event or not to be part of a scandal. Winning the event gains you rating points, which can be combined to obtain the control of ministries. By participating in a scandal players lose rating points, which can lead to losing the control of ministries. After the week ends (fifth event is resolved), played party members are returned to the player and the new week is started. The game is finished after two in-game months (8 weeks or 40 events) or when one player controls at least 7 (out of 14) ministries. The winner is the player who controls ministries which required most rating points to obtain.

—user summary

PolitinÄ—s satyros Å¾aidimas. 2016 m Lietuvos Seimo rinkimÅ³ parodija.

JÅ«s vadovaujate partijai ir dešimÄiai jos rinktiniÅ³ nariÅ³. Iki rinkimÅ³ liko vos du mÄ—nesiai, o kasdieniai Ä¯vykiai neleidÅ¾ia atsikvÄ—pti nÄ— minutei. Kaip Seime, taip ir Šeime - rinkimai visada yra išbandymÅ³ metas.

—description from the back of the box (Lithuanian)

Kiekvienas partijos narys turi teigiamÅ³ arba neigiamÅ³ kompetencijos taškÅ³ kiekvienoje iš keturiÅ³ sriÄiÅ³ (ekonomika, krašto ir gamtos, socialiniÅ³ ir skandalÅ³). Po savaitÄ—s (kai išsprendÅ¾iamas penktasis Ä¯vykis), Å¾aidÄ—jai atgauna panaudotus partijos narius ir pradedama nauja savaitÄ—. Å½aidimas baigiasi po dviejÅ³ Å¾aidimo mÄ—nesiÅ³ (aštuoniÅ³ savaiÄiÅ³; 40 Ä¯vykiÅ³) arba kai vienas iš Å¾aidÄ—jÅ³ kontroliuoja 7 (iš 14) ministerijas. Laimi Å¾aidÄ—jas, kurio kontroliuojamÅ³ ministerijÅ³ vertÄ— didÅ¾iausia.

—description from the back of the box (User summary)

Name: World War Tesla: Starter Set
Description:
World War Tesla is a 15mm scale alternate-history WWI wargame, where Nicola Tesla’s more radical ideas such as death rays and force fields have come to fruition, changing the face of a world at war. Giant walking tanks, soldiers with rocket-packs, and flying machines armed with death rays rule the battlefield. All game components are printed at home on a 3D printer, with files included for all vehicles, troops, some terrain, and game accessories.

—description from the publisher

Name: Resilience
Description:
Overview and Theme: In Resilience, you will lead your armies to capture lands for your chosen banner, trade resources with your neighbors, negotiate terms with your allies and your enemies, build mighty strongholds and battle those who stand in your way! You will choose the actions for each of your armies that will in turn, change the shape of the land and the outcome of the game.

Goal: The game of Resilience is played with 2 to 4 players, each attempting to be the first to build a level 4 stronghold and become the winner of the game. The levels of a stronghold are as follows: 1-Keep 2-Wall 3-Moat 4-Victory

The Game Board: The game is played on square land tiles that are laid down between the player's war camps. The land tiles are one of three types, Desert, Plains or Forest, each having a different land value associated with them. The more land value a player controls, the higher they can build their stronghold to win the game.

Some of the land tiles have mountains that limit where a player's commander can move to and may be rotated by the players to alter the game board, benefiting or hindering a player's strategy.

Game-Play: Each player has 3 commanders that they use to move around the game board and interact with the land tiles. On each player's turn, they may use each commander once to claim land tiles, use special abilities or battle opponent commanders.

Battle: Each commander has an army that is made up of 1 to 3 army cards. Army cards may be; Infantry, Archer, Cavalry or a Diplomat. In a Rock-Paper-Scissor fashion each player reveals cards, one at a time, from the commander army to battle: Infantry beats Cavalry, Cavalry beats Archer, Archer beats Infantry. The diplomat serves as the wild-card; when used in battle, both players are forced to roll a 6-sided die to determine the victor of that particular fight.

Trading: Players may trade away land tiles they control to other willing players, and in return, they re-collect army cards that have been discarded or resurrect fallen commanders.

Fun fact: No player can truly be eliminated. Even if a player looses all of their commanders and land tiles, they can always accept trade from other players, bringing them back into the game.

Name: Pirates Chase Game
Description:
Pirates Chase Game is a simple spin-and-move game for 2 players. One player plays the part of the Pirates (who controls 3 ships) and the other player is the Cargo Ship Captain (who controls 1 ship). The object of the game is for the Pirate player to land exactly on the same space as the Cargo Ship with on of his ships, thus winning the game for the pirates. If the Cargo Ship is able to make it once around the board without being sunk, then the Cargo Ship Captain player wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Star Command: The Board Game
Description:
The object of the game is to secure the bases of the star with your missiles and defense shields. A base is secured when you land your missile on a base and when you play your defensive shield on the spot in front of it. The game is won when a player secures three bases.

Essentially, Star Command: The Board Game is a roll-and-move game where each player is trying to move to the bases before the other player. A couple of rules allow players to attempt knocking out their opponents' missiles and secured bases as well.

—user summary

Name: Land Ahead!
Description:
Land Ahead! is a fast-paced game in which players together explore an unexplored island. The players take turns placing six-sided island tiles, forming the coast lines, locations and roads of the island.

The game is highly strategic as tiles will have to be placed in ways that benefit you, forming roads for your player figure to follow. This while preventing other players from reaching the island’s locations before you!

Every time a location is discovered, a round event token is placed on top of the location. These tokens depict villages, castles and forests and trigger events when reached by one of the players.

Will you befriend a stray animal that can help you on your journey or will you be attacked by a fearsome monster? Perhaps find powerful equipment or valuable treasure?

During the game you will improve your abilities by finding equipment and placing it on the corresponding equipment slot of your player tile. All equipment will improve either your offense, defense or movement ability to some extent.

Will you become powerful enough to defeat the monsters and win the game as the monster slayer? Maybe you’ll become great at evading attacks while collecting treasure and win the game as the treasure hunter?

One thing is for sure - no two games will ever be the same!

—description from the designer

Name: Outbreak
Description:
A Cooperative hybrid; Defensive Combat, Area Control, Worker Placement, Territory Building, Push Your Luck, Strategic Survival Game.

Outbreak is a cooperative board game for 1 to 8 players. You play as a survivor group in a post-apocalyptic world where you are trying to protect the Survivor City from the zombie hordes, before they reach the Main Base and kill the helpless inside. Players control a skilled survivor or team of survivors (in solo play), that must work together to fight back the hordes of zombies.

Players start by constructing the survivor city around the Main Base. This safe area is now surrounded by zombie hordes whose goal is to reach the main base and eat all the survivors inside, overrunning settlements along the way. When a settlement is overrun, players can no longer request its support, so each turn players must attempt to destroy zombie hordes and prepare for the next wave of attacks. This is a very challenging game where cooperation is the key to surviving the zombie apocalypse!

No two games will ever be the same. The game features over 100 different zombies, over 20 survivor settlements and over 150 action cards, which combine for a fresh challenge every time you play.

Features:
Fully cooperative immersive game play
Solo or up to eight players!    
Unique drop in/out game feature
Build your very own city    
Learn skills
Resource gathering & management  
Very challenging game play
Construct: weapons, vehicles, buildings and much more    
Overwhelming numbers of unique zombies
10 playable characters!

—description from the designer

Name: Railway Rivals Map GW: Great Western
Description: A map to be used with Railways Rivals or Dampfross games covering the area of the Great Western Railway Company from London to Bristol to a scale of 1 hex = 5km

Name: Zooloretto: Squirrel
Description:
A promo expansion for Zooloretto

The expansion consists of one 1 tile with a squirrel.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule:
The first player to fill his 6-space enclosure gets the squirrel enclosure as a bonus. As a money action, it allows that player to move a tile from his barn to a delivery truck.

Name: Les Légendaires: Le jeu – L'antre du gardien
Description:
Boardgame adapted from the very popular French comic "Les Légendaires".

Run a extraordinary adventure with magic and fantasy.
Being one of their favorite character (Danaël, Jadina, Gryf, Shimy or Razzia), the players will have to cooperate in order to solve the challenges given by the Guardian and save Alysia's World.
—description from the publisher (translated)

Vivez une extraordinaire aventure grâce à ce jeu de plateau mêlant la magie et le fantastique ! En incarnant Danaël, Jadina, Gryf, Shimy ou Razzia, chaque joueur doit collaborer avec les autres pour résoudre les défis lancés par le Gardien et sauver le monde d'Alysia.
—description from the publisher (French)

Name: Railway Rivals Map SC: Scotland
Description: A map for use with Railways Rivals or Dampfross covering most of Scotland from Carlisle to Inverness to a scale of 1 hex = 7.5km

Name: Railway Rivals  Map: South East USA
Description: A map for use  with Railway Rivals or Dampfross games covering the South West area of USA from St Louis to Washington to Jacksonville to Baton Rouge.

Name: Geek me quiz
Description: A trivia box of over 700 questions and 130 challenges about TV Series, Litterature, Movies, Comics, Mangas and Anime, and Video Games.

Name: Quadrio
Description:
In the two-player game Quadrio, players compete to be the first to place four discs in a row — but it's tricky to do so since the discs can move to new locations as players rotate the plastic device that serves as the playing area.

The playing field is a 4x4 grid that's overlaid with troughs on each side of it, with troughs on opposite sides of the field running perpendicular to one another. On a turn, a player slides one of their discs into a trough. That's it! Before or after inserting a disc, a player can hold the device by any of the four corners and turn it to look at either side. When a player grabs a different corner and holds the device by it, discs inside might slide in their troughs to new positions. Have you created a four-in-a-row of your discs (on one or a combination of both sides of the playing area) after taking your turn? If so, you win!

Games of Quadrio can be quick as it's hard to keep an eye on all eight possible orientations of the device. Thus, the publisher recommends playing multiple rounds, such as seeing who can first win three games out of five.

Name: Neon
Description:
The Ember has gone out, but the game is not over! The popular game from 2016 is being rebuilt with a fresh reprint, revised rules, and brand new art.

A completely standalone game that has its roots in Ember: the Magical Card Game, Neon is a brand new game that is compatible with the Ember, but has a completely new system of gathering the elemental energy to conjure creatures, along with a questing system, and an experience-points system that allows you to buy items, gain familiars, or to level up and increase your power.

Neon is played with 15 creatures from One to Five VP, and each creature sits in its own stack of five cards. Most of the creatures have powers, and one has a super power, while another has no ability at all. You may only conjure the top card in your turn, and each creature will drain some - or all - of your magical energy, so choose wisely.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marco Bohno
Description:
Now you can play Bohnanza on a voyage of discovery! Following in the footsteps of Marco Bohno, the adventurous bean gardeners not only have to pull in successful harvests, but also fulfill special tasks on their journey along the Great Wall of China. Each task brings the adventurer one step closer to their destination.

Marco Bohno can be played only with the Bohnanza base game or the Ladybohn base game. The game contains both a two-person variant and solo variant. This extension was previously published under the title Bohnröschen, but for a different player count with different materials in it.

Name: Railway Rivals Map JU: Yugoslavia
Description: A map for use with Railway Rivals and Dampfross games covering Yugoslavia to a scale of 1 hex = 20km.

Name: Knight Line: 3 Player Expansion
Description:
Knight Line 3-player expansion.

Contains 20 red tiles.

Play as usual with the following changes to the rules:

1. No restriction of White’s first move.

2. if a player is forced to pass, the game is over, all draw.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – General Veers Commander Expansion
Description:
Within the General Veers Commander Expansion for Star Wars: Legion, you'll find all the materials that you need to add General Veers to your army as a commander — leading an army on his own or standing side-by-side with another Imperial commander, such as Darth Vader.

This expansion pack offers an unpainted General Veers miniature and his three personal command cards, inviting you to bring Veers' personal touch to the Imperial armies that you lead into battle. What's more, like other Unit Expansions for Star Wars: Legion, this Commander Expansion includes a unit card for General Veers and an assortment of upgrade cards that you can use to equip General Veers or another unit for battle in even the most hostile environments.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Hannover
Description: The travel destination "Hannover" will be available in Hannover.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Snowtroopers Unit Expansion
Description:
No matter how dangerous the freezing temperatures on a planet, you’ll find that your Snowtroopers are equipped to handle the killing cold with ease. Within the Snowtroopers Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion, you’ll find seven unpainted Snowtrooper miniatures, inviting you to field these troopers as a single unit and combat the Rebellion in even the most hostile and adverse environments. Alongside these Snowtroopers, you’ll find an assortment of upgrade cards, inviting you to kit out your Snowtroopers for whatever you expect to face on the field of battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Swordpoint: Chariot Armies
Description:
Army list book containing 34 armies with additional variants, covering the period from 3000 BC to 700 BC. Army lists include:

Sumerian and Akkadian
Old and Middle Kingdom Egyptian
Elam
Minoan & Early Mycenaean
Libyan
Nubian
Harappan Indian
Arab Nomad
Early Assyrian
Early Babylonian
Shang Chinese
Early Eastern Tribes
Old Hittite Kingdom
Hyksos
European Bronze Age
Mitanni
Syrian and Canaanite
Aryan Indian
New Kingdom Egyptian
Hittite Empire
Middle Assyrian
Sea Peoples
Trojan War
Philistine
Dark Age Greece
Israelite
Zhou Chinese
Libyan Egyptian
Cimmerian and Scythian
Urartian
Kushite Egyptian
Later Babylonian
Neo-Assyrian
Saite Egyptian
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

Name: I.C.O.
Description:
A game of wise planning and crypto investing.

You are an upstart tech investor with a penchant for Cryptocurrency. Each time a coin forms big money will be paid out to top stakeholders. The player with the most fiat at the end of the game wins.

Each turn, players draw and event card that will affect their turn or all players next turns and then, play a hex tile from their hand on the board to establish new coins, merge existing coins, or grow existing coins. They then buy tokens vying to become majority or minority stakeholders so they can receive a payout upon a merger. 
Player's may then research their coins and sell or trade their coins as they see fit.

Player with the most Fiat at the end of the game wins!

Name: Emergent: The Supply Chain Strategy Game
Description:
Enter the business world as the president of a new company competing for consumers' money. Build your supply chain and your brand to become the leader in supply chain agility, but watch out: your competitors will do everything they can to stop you!

Emergent is a game about supply chain network strategy with game theory elements. The goal of Emergent is to build a network of Distribution Centers (DCs) to make the most money by satisfying customer demand by selling products from your DCs to nearby cities. The game ends after round 4, and the player with the most money is the winner.

Each Round, all players use a strategic planning board to purchase distribution centers, stock them with inventory and invest in marketing. This is done secretly until all players are ready. At this point, each strategy is revealed and players execute the strategy by placing their distribution centers, marketing chips, and inventory onto the main board. The demand is then revealed for each city on the board.

Players are able to fulfill demand to each city based on their whether they are the market leader, closest shipper, or the only available inventory. Players then receive revenue and pay costs and the round ends.

Players continue playing for 4 rounds. The player with the most money by the end of the game wins!

Emergent simulates strategic supply chain decisions that lead companies to real success in the marketplace. It punishes timid play and over-zealous strategies, leading people to react carefully to the strategies of competing companies.

Name: Enchanters: Browntails Den Promo Card
Description:
A Kickstarter Exclusive promo card.

The card is a village (of which one random is in play)

The players have the following effects:

1. Start with 15 crystals, but lose 1 crystal at the start of each turn.

2. During a fight, pay 2 crystals, add 1 strength

3. While resting, gain 5 crystals

4. At the end of the game, gain 1 victory for each 5 crystals

Name: Districts: Barcelona
Description:
Districts: Barcelona is a game for up to 4 players about the different interests and tensions that transforms a city over time and how they are related. The City works as an ecosystem and its citizens try to adapt and transform it to match their needs. Sometimes, such changes come as a by product of some direct actions, some other times it comes from direct developments that come through the administration or private investments.

We assess that it’s not possible to witness such changes and transformations as a neutral witness: everyone is biased by its own experiences and perspective. Due to that, we have developed the different factions as how they perceive themselves. That is, portraying each of them per their own self-defined virtues and what they consider works best for most of the citizens, when not for everyone. Of course, as after all this is a game, for the sake of game balance we have adjusted certain values and actions to provide a better playability.

The game is designed for 4 players (but rules are provided for 3 and 2 players) and the city map is divided in districts. Each district has an array of values that describe its economic and population statistics. These values are a common pool for all the players, this means that your actions deplete some values to increase others, but doing so you might enable a 2nd player to play its actions in that district.

The game has no luck component whatsoever, players' actions have a basic effect no matter where they play them, and an additional effect if certain values are matched. Each faction consumes certain resources and generate others, and not a single faction is autonomous: each of them requires at least one resource they can not generate.

—description from the publisher

Name: Unstable Unicorns: Rainbow Apocalypse Expansion Pack
Description:
Kill your enemies with kindness...or a massive plague.

This expansion pack contains 27 adorably destructive cards and 27 that are full of apocalyptic mayhem!

Includes: 54 cards

—description from the publisher

This expansion contains the cards from both the Rainbow Sprinkles and Apocalypse expansion packs which were offered as part of the first Unstable Unicorns Kickstarter.

Name: Unstable Unicorns: Dragons Expansion Pack
Description:
Let your game of Unstable Unicorns take flight!

This 54 card expansion adds dragon-themed Upgrade, Downgrade, and Magic cards, along with all-new Unicorns to battle. Who will rule the skies over your Stable?

Includes: 54 Fire-breathing Cards


        Cards should not actually breathe fire. If you see flames, something has gone horribly wrong.
    


—description from the publisher

This expansion contains all 27 cards from the original Kickstarter version of the Dragons.

Name: Spring
Description:
Spring, a game of flowers and growing gardens, is a 18 cards microgame.

In Spring each player takes turn placing a card on other previously played cards. Each card shows four groups of flowers and, in order to play it, you should place it overlapping other cards in play, parallel to them, never perpendicular, and covering at least one symbol that do need to match the one(s) on your card. The goal is being the player with the largest garden (area of orthogonally connected groups of flowers) at the end of the game.

Name: Evrwyn: The Blight of Tarvana
Description:
Evrwyn is a high fantasy role-playing tabletop card game that takes you on an epic journey to find Tarvana and end her blight. Traverse the Valencian Empire, scouring through forgotten dungeons, busy settlements, and treacherous terrain. Choose between many unique races, classes, and professions to navigate this volatile realm. Evrwyn’s gameplay combines storytelling, group strategy, unforeseen opportunities, character customization, and survival. Because of Evrwyn’s many random features, each gaming experience will be unique. Encounter a plethora of travel and dungeon events that test even the most seasoned players. Taking chances, pursuing riches, and rolling the dice can lead to powerful discoveries or your ultimate demise. Evrwyn will test your group’s strengths and expose its weaknesses. Your allies may not always have your best interest in mind.

—description from the designer

Name: Send Me Up
Description:
Inspired on the one hit wonder song Spirit in the Sky by Norman Greenbaum.


Send Me Up is a cooperative "trick fixing" game meant to simulate giving a eulogy.  Players use a deck of playing cards and a die to cooperatively "fix" a trick to produce a specific value.

The game is played over multiple tricks, with each trick having a different target number.  If the players can collectively fix six tricks over the course of the game, they have given a touching eulogy and sent the spirit happily to the sky, thus winning the game.


Send Me Up is the postcard game from Button Shy's December 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Blobbiemundo
Description:
The amazing collectible trading card game that introduces a new combat dynamic.

Blobbiemorph into the most powerful shapes in existence and participate in fantastical battles between modern animals, dinosaurs, warriors, and more!

Battle your opponents with 7 unique abilities: 
Attack • Speed • Confusion • Defense • Perception • Camouflage • Weaponry

Change Environments and Eras to modify the rules of the Battlefield.

Use the Trenches for surprise attacks.

Activate Magical abilities for new game strategies!

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Rojo
Description:
The Red Deck contains shapes of higher Attack values in average.
Each Introductory Sructure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Anaranjado
Description:
The Orange Deck contains shapes of higher Speed values in average.
Each Introductory Sructure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Amarillo
Description:
The Yellow Deck contains shapes of higher Confusion values in average.
Each Introductory Sructure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Verde
Description:
The Green Deck contains shapes of higher Defense values in average.
Each Introductory Structure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Azul
Description:
The Blue Deck contains shapes of higher Perception values in average.
Each Introductory Sructure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Índigo
Description:
The Indigo Deck contains shapes of higher Camouflage values in average.
Each Introductory Sructure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Mazo Violeta
Description:
The Violet Deck contains shapes of higher Weaponry values in average.
Each Introductory Sructure contains 50 Cards (1 Refractive), 15 Vitality Counters, 1 Environment Counter, 1 Playmat, and 1 Rulebook.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Masacre Cromática
Description: The first Blobbiemundo expansion includes all the cards present in the 7 Introductory Decks plus 195 new Cards (including 50 Refractive Cards).

Name: Immortality
Description:
After the immortal God Zeus, king of the gods, has a particularly boring period in his existence, he decides he wants to have some fun with a few humans.He invites four people to meet him at his temple where he explains he wishes to give the gift of immortality to one of them but they have to prove there worth.

To do this, he leads them to a maze at the back of his temple where he bluntly states that the first person to get out the other end, if anyone at all does, will be granted Immortality and be recognised as a friend of Zeus.

The game is played by people playing as these characters trying to be the first one to reach the maze exit.Each character has an ability unique to them, such as the mage having a higher max energy allowance or the warrior using an extra battle dice.

Each turn consists of rolling turn dice to see what actions can be made by the player which include but is not.limited to, dealing damage to other players, drawing cards, buying equipment, healing etc. Cards can be drawn from two decks open to all players but the deck with the exit in cannot be drawn from until players meet certain criteria.

—description from the designer

Name: North & South
Description:
North & South brings you to the future, to a place where two armies troop together at each other's border, ready to enter into the inevitable confrontation.
As the commanding officer of the northern troops, you try to determine the positions and the strength of the enemy elite troops by means of some daring moves.
The opponent from the South tries to do the same and the consequences soon make themselves felt. Skirmishes in the air and on land quickly lead to true trials of strength in which now the North and then the South is winning.
Luck only plays a minor part and the better strategist will win increasingly more battles. Only recklessness or a surprise counteroffensive can still stop him from winning the war.

—user summary

Name: The U.S. Army Game
Description:
This is a WWI trick-taking card game. The 53-card deck is divided into four suits by service: Infantry (blue), Cavalry (yellow), Artillery (red) and Engineers (green). Each card has a detailed illustration of an individual of each rank in dress uniform, and a colored border that includes the value of the card, branch of service, symbol of service, rank and rank symbol.

Each suit is numbered from 1 to 12 in ascending order of rank: Private (1), Corporal, Sergeant, 2nd Lieutenant, 1st Lieutenant, Captain, Major, Lieutenant Colonel, Colonel, Brigadier General, Major General, and General (12).

In addition, there are four black (unsuited) cards illustrating military technology: Machine-Gun (5), Armored Motor-car (10), Air-Ship (15) and Tank (20), as well as a President and Commander-in-Chief card.

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Secret Agent
Description:
The new, self-named country of Zekestan holds the world in its grasp. Their show of power and threatening language about their secret weapon is absolutely frightening. The way in which the new President came to power seems only a small taste of what his sick mind is up to. There is only one way to stop him, and you have to find that way with your team of specialists! If you are caught, any involvement by your government will be denied and you are on your own — and you know what they do with traitors in Zekestan...

Secret Agent is an expansion for Escape Room: The Game.

—description from the publisher (translated)
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Escape Room: The Game – The Dentist
Description:
Expansion for Escape Room The Game. Dr. Siènski, your dentist, has invited you for a check-up. With some reluctance you have accepted his invite and you find yourself in his dentist chair. Before you know it he put a cap on your face. The last thing you hear is a the voice of Dr. Siènski, who says  he is going to administer some laughing gas so you won’t feel any pain when he puls your tooth. Then everything goes black around you ...

—description from the publisher (translated)
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: L'Histoire Romaine
Description:
This is one of a series of four card games published in the 1700s in France known collectively as the "Cartes Historiques". While the box is not dated, Hargrave's History dates the deck to 1760.

L'Histoire Romaine has a deck of 48 cards, numbered with Roman numerals, plus a card with rules of the game. The cards are printed on thick stock from wood blocks, with square corners and blank backs. At the top of each card is the name of an historical character and a circled portrait. Below the portrait, and taking up most of the card, is a biography of the individual. The box shows E. Jouy as the author of the biographies.

The game seems to have been educational in nature, with the player drawing a card announcing its name, and the other player(s) having to come up with one or more relevant facts from the biography. Correct answers win the card, with the winner being the player who collects the most cards.

Name: 六次化農村 (Sixth Rural Village)
Description:
In å…­æ¬¡åŒ–è¾²æ‘ (Sixth Rural Village), the player runs a farming village, aiming to develop and contribute to the village the most as a farmer over the course of six years (six rounds). To do this, players must earn money by making crops and livestock products, then selling them. Additionally, players need to demonstrate great leadership in the village parliament in order to make processing buildings that create more valuable products to sell. Also, the parliament will decide who receives subsidies, so you need to keep this in mind. Furthermore, you will be forced to make a very difficult choice between how much you will focus on parliament and focus on the village.

This is a heavyweight game that asks you to consider various elements such as product trends, field and building positions, and voting in parliament, but each element is well intertwined, making it an enjoyable game.

Name: Find It Fast!: Disney Princess
Description:
Place card stack face down on table. Turn over two cards onto table. Players race to find the matching Disney Princess character shared by both cards. The first to call the Disney Princess character takes and keeps one card. Turn over the next card. The first to call the match keeps a card. Play continues until one card remains. Player with the most cards wins!

Includes 48 cards & instructions

Name: The Dewey Game
Description:
This is a word game similar to Anagrams, but with the specific objective of forming the last names of 14 admirals who served in the U.S. Navy during or prior to the Spanish-American War. The game is named after Admiral of the Navy George Dewey, and seems to have been published to cash in on the glory of then Commodore Dewey's victory over the Spanish fleet at Manila Bay.

The names run in value from Admiral Albert S. Barker (10 points) to Admiral Dewey (100 points). The game contains 77 plain square letter tiles, one for each of the letters in the names on the list of admirals.

Players initially draw a hand of 10 tiles, and attempt to form, in whole or in part, names from the list. On each turn, a player draws a tile from the face-down stack, and if possible adds it to one of his names in progress. Instead of drawing from the stack, a player may steal a face-up tile from another player needed for one of his own names, provided that his own partial name is closer to completion than his opponent's. Letters may not be stolen from completed names. Completing a name grants an additional tile draw.

When the draw pile runs out, players may continue to steal, and the game ends when no further plays are possible. The winner is the player who completes the highest point-value worth of names.

Name: Obscenity: A Shameless Adult Party Game
Description:
Obscenity is a shameless adult party game where you play in teams against the clock to describe or act out as many dirty phrases as you can without repeating any of the words on the cards.

It's a simple, fast-paced game which will make you laugh so hard it's quite possible a little bit of wee will come out.

The game contains 924 naughty words and phrases, many of which you should already know. Your less innocent friends and / or the power of the internet will help you to discover the meanings of the rest.

Each box of Obscenity includes 308 cards, a 60 second sand timer and game rules.

Obscenity can also be played as a drinking game and the drinking rules are included with the game.

Due to the naughty nature of the game, we recommend that it's played by people who are 17+ years of age.

Name: Confessions: The Game of Secrets and Lies
Description:
Confessions: The Game of Secrets & Lies is a simple bluffing game. You read a card prompt and tell a story, giving as many or as few details as you want. The other players guess if you're telling the truth or a lie. The genius? The card prompts range from hilarious to fantastically awkward.

If you enjoy playing games like Cards Against Humanity, Truth or Dare & Never Have I Ever, it's likely that you'll LOVE playing Confessions.

Each Confessions pack includes 308 cards (298 Confession cards & 10 voting cards).

Confessions can also be played as an adult drinking game and the alternative drinking rules are included with the game.

Due to the naughty nature of the Confessions game, we recommend that it's played by guys and girls who are 17+ years of age.

This is NOT a family card game and we strongly recommend that you don’t play this with your parents or children.

Name: Le diable du pont de Valentré
Description:
Le diable du pont de Valentré (literally "The devil from Valentré's bridge") is a card game for 2 to 6 players inspired by a French tale and a comic book drawn by the game author. Each player plays the architect in charge of building Valentré's bridge, but as the legend says, the devil comes at night to steal stones from the bridge.

This is a classic card game where at his turn, each player draws a card and then can either get the resources necessary to build the bridge (so-called "key" cards), protect his keys ("shield" cards), attack  an opponent ("claws" cards), build his bridge or discard.

The game ends after the first player builds the bridge.

—description from the publisher

Name: The X-Files: Conspiracy Theory – Everything is Connected
Description:
After another truly unbelievable case comes to an end, Agent Fox Mulder finds himself in a familiar seat — directly across from his superiors at the FBI. While Agent Scully urged him tell a story that the panel would accept, Mulder's need to believe is just too great.

In The X-Files: Conspiracy Theory – Everything is Connected, players take turns at Fox Mulder as he uses the provided clues to explain his conspiracy theory to his FBI superiors. But reputation is everything at the FBI, and Mulder's superiors are more interested in voting with the room rather than their gut. Mulder weaves together the conspiracy, and the superiors must deduce the way the rest of the room will vote...because the only thing worse than being an outlier is being a nut-case like Fox Mulder.

The game includes a second game mode, based on Jose Chung, from one of the most famous episodes of The X-Files: "From Outer Space". Other players play as witnesses to a paranormal event and Jose Chung must look at all the evidence they provide and create a complete narrative that ties all their stories together.

Name: Taï-Hou
Description:
A game related to Chinese Chess and Dou Shou Qi, played on an 11×12 board. Each player has eleven pieces numbered "1 Nightingale" through "10 Arrow", plus "Lotus Flower".

According to Cazaux and Knowlton's book "A World of Chess" (2017), this game was discovered on an online auction site in France in 2016.

Name: Ticket to Ride: Europe – London/København
Description:
Golden Ticket given away by retailers to people who came to see a Ticket To Ride Demo.  This Ticket was also given away on the December 2017 issue of Tabletop Gaming Magazine.

This route is worth 8 points.

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Albatros D.III
Description:
The Albatros D.III was the continuation of the line of “shark shaped” fighters that began with the D.I in the fall of 1916. Among the improvements was adopting the “sesquiplane” design from the Nieuport fighters, gaining climb and visibility, but weakening the structure. Still, the D.III dominated the skies and was the main killer during “Bloody April.” The Austrians built the D.III under license and actually managed to improve on the original. There were still some in combat at the Armistice.

Albatros D.III (Frommherz)
Hermann Frommherz went from 2-seater pilot to the famous Jasta 2, where his first fighter was the “Blau Maus.” He survived World War I with 32 victories.

Albatros D.III (Gruber)
Kurt Gruber’s first victory came with the Austro–Hungarian ace Godwin Brumowski manning the guns in his Albatros 2–seater, and they fought together again in this D.III in Flik 41J.

Albatros D.III (Von Richthofen)
Manfred von Richthofen, to flaunt his prowess in front of the enemy, painted this airplane completely bright red, partly obscuring its markings. For this reason, he became universally known as the “Red Baron.”

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Nieuport 17
Description:
The Nieuport 17 was a nimble fighter, first released in March 1916. Its excellent maneuverability made a big impact. It soon equipped all of the French fighter squadrons, served as a top British fighter for a year, and was even copied by the Germans! The “sesquiplane” design (a “half” lower wing) gave excellent climb and visibility, but was a weakness in stressful maneuvers. A favorite of aces, the Nieuport 17 was produced in France, Italy, and Russia and used by all Allied armies until late 1917.

Nieuport 17 (Baracca)
Francesco Baracca was Italy’s top ace of World War I, with 34 kills, several of them in this Nieuport 17. His “prancing horse” symbol was later adopted by Ferrari.

Nieuport 17 (Charles Nungesser)
The flamboyant pilot, preferred Nieuports, even after his squadron switched to SPADs. He survived World War I as France’s #3 scoring ace.

Nieuport 17 (Thaw/Lufbery)
American volunteers and French officers fought side–by–side in the “Escadrille Lafayette.” Cards for two of them, Raoul Lufbery and Bill Thaw, are featured in this model.

Name: UNO: Marvel Ultimate Spider-man Web-Warriors Card Game
Description:
With great power comes great fun in this Ultimate Spider-Man edition of UNO game!
Get yourself out of a sticky situation with the special "Web Slinger" card!
Listen to your Spidey-Sense and yell "UNO!" before you play your last card!
—description from the publisher

This variant of UNO differs in that there are 'web slinger' wild cards.  They are wild plus you get to 'sling' up to 3 cards from your hand, all of the same color, to other players' hands (however you choose).
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Dong Wu Qi
Description:
A game produced in the 1950s, comparable to but significantly different from the game with the same name Dong Wu Qi that's more widely known today. The name just means "Animal Chess" or "Animals Game".

It's a chess-style game played on a 9x13 board, with each player having 16 different animal pieces. The animals are grouped into four different categories with four different movement rules (domestic animals, wild animals, insects and birds): within each group, weaker animals may not capture stronger animals. Each player's Lion piece, the most powerful of the wild animals, is confined to the mountain area at the end of the board, and the object of the game is to capture the opponent's Lion.

This game is described in Cazaux and Knowlton "A World of Chess" (2017) as having been discovered in an online auction in China.

Name: Shattered Nations
Description:
Shattered Nations is a strategic game where you pit an army of your own design against an opponent’s army. Choose your actions and moves carefully, even one misstep can change the tide of battle and turn victory into defeat.

The goal of the game is to destroy all of your opponents commanders before they destroy yours.

Players will build an “Army” based off an agreed upon point army point value, deploy their army onto the battlefield, and attempt to destroy their enemy’s commanders.

The battlefield is a simple yet devastating beast. Broken down into three separate zones, each zone provides a specific function to a player.

Command Line – The command line is the key to victory. This is where the army commanders start the game. Only commanders and heroes can be here.

Deployment Line – The Deployment line is how you get new troops onto the battlefield. You play cards from your hand into this location.

Front Line – The Front Line is where the action happens. Units must be on the front-line to attack the enemy.

To move your soldiers around and attack you will need to issue commands via action cards. Each turn players will only be able to perform three actions. There are 5 types of actions they can take. Each round players will pre-select their actions. This is critical because it locks you into those actions for that round. Not choosing wisely may result in you not being able to use all the actions allotted to you.

Attack Action: used for a unit in the Front-Line to attack the most forward unit in the opposing Command Line. Attacking with a unit “exhausts” the unit. (see combat section more details on attacking and killing units).

Deploy Action: used to move a unit from your hand to the deployment zone of an active Command Line. Deploying a unit “exhausts” the unit.

Advance Action: used to advance any unit forward in the same command line. Advancing a unit “exhausts” the unit.

Event Action: used to play an event card from your hand.

Ability Action: used to activate a unit’s ability. Using a unit’s ability “exhausts” the unit.

Combining these actions and clever use of the battlefield will assure you a victory. Be careful though, it is of paramount importance to interpret your opponent’s battlefield and predict what actions they will be using.

Assemble your army, deploy your troops, destroy your enemies commanders!

Name: Tic Tac Moo
Description:
The young farmers in Tic Tac Moo have their hands full driving the farm animals onto the meadow. On top of that, the animals are very status-conscious as to who is allowed to enter the grassland next to them, and if too many animals of one kind stand together, it can easily happen that some will go astray. Under these circumstances, how are you supposed to gather enough of them?

In more detail, each player has a set of 24 animal tokens that are shuffled at the start of the game. The game board is an 8x8 grid with the corners cut off; the outer rows on all sides are neutral space, while the inner section has four 3x3 fields, two each in the color of one of the players. To start the game, players place two of their animal tokens face up on their farmhand spaces and a third animal token in their barn. They then take turns placing four starting animal tokens on the board, one in each of their colored fields.

On a turn, a player must place both tokens held by farmhands onto empty spaces in the grid — whether in their color, the opponent's color, or neutral territory — and they must place them adjacent to tokens showing the same animal as the one in their barn. If their barn has a pig token, for example, then they must place both tokens next to pig tokens already on the board, whether orthogonally or diagonally. If while doing so they create a line of three or more of the same animal tokens, they remove all of these animal tokens from the board and keep them except for the token that they just placed.

If a player manages to fill one of their colored 3x3 grids with two pairs of each of the four animals (and a third animal of some type), then they immediately win. Alternatively, a player can win immediately by capturing at least twelve animals.

Name: My Love
Description: MY LOVE is the exciting foreplay for all those who have newly fallen in love, intimate couples, or just anybody who has butterflies in her or his stomach! The 240 questions for HER and HIM in the areas of love, sex, and affection bring the players closer to each other and encourage them to playfully deepen their erotic knowledge together.
